items.description: The River Burn from Southgate and Waterden to Burnham Thorpe
items.message: This message has been issued because some minor flooding to low lying land, roads and riverside areas is likely over the next few hours and into this evening, Saturday 8 May. The River Burn is rising steadily in response to today's rainfall.   The weather forecast is for further rainfall until early evening.  This could lead to raised groundwater levels. The forecast is for continued unsettled weather over the next couple of days. Take care on riverside footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are monitoring the situation and are not expecting the situation to escalate.  We will update this message by 9am tomorrow, Sunday 9 May.

River levels have risen at the Pilings river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible to begin today between 16:00 and 17:00, Saturday, 08/05/21.  Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point. Further light rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high overnight Sunday, 09/05/21. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning Sunday, 09/05/21, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Sandyford Brook, Ridings Brook, Saredon Brook

items.message:
River levels have risen at the Stafford river gauge as a result of persistent heavy rainfall overnight and this morning, Saturday 08/05/2021. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected to begin this morning, Saturday 08/05/21. Flooding is expected to affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Sow between Great Bridgeford and Shugborough, the River Penk between Coven and Stafford, the Sandyford Brook, the Rising Brook, the Ridings Brook and the Saredon Brook.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours, with unsettled conditions forecast to continue over the coming days.
Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 09/05/21, or as the situation changes.

River levels have risen at the Hints river gauge as a result of persistent heavy rainfall overnight and this morning, Saturday 08/05/2021. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected to begin this afternoon, Saturday 08/05/21. Flooding is expected to affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to the Bourne Brook. Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours, with unsettled conditions forecast to continue over the coming days. Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast. Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 09/05/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: The River Stiffkey from Fulmodeston to Warham
items.message: This message has been issued because some minor flooding to low lying land, roads and riverside areas is likely from now and into this evening, Saturday 8 May 2021. River levels are beginning to react to recent rainfall. We are not currently expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time. The forecast is for continued unsettled weather over the next couple of days. Take care on riverside footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are monitoring the situation and are not expecting the situation to escalate.  We will update this message by 10am tomorrow, Sunday 9 May.
